items.title: Buying an index fund is like outsourcing stock decisions, says Derek Brodersen of Quantum Advisors India
items.description: He said that investing in an index fund is somewhat like buying quantitative funds where algorithms are used to pick stocks. The algorithms can be based on revenue, earnings, and other things, he added.

items.title: Broader indices underperform with 200 smallcaps record double digit fall
items.description: During the week, the BSE Large-cap Index shed 3.4 percent, BSE Mid-cap Index declined 4.4 percent and the BSE Small-cap index shed 6 percent.

items.title: Market extends weekly losses on tariff concern; all sectors in the red
items.description: The market capitalization of BSE-listed companies fell nearly Rs 20 lakh crore in this week.

items.title: Wall Street ends higher after Zelenskiy and Trump clash
items.description: The S&P 500 climbed 1.59% to end the session at 5,954.50 points. The Nasdaq gained 1.63% to 18,847.28 points, while the Dow Jones Industrial Average rose 1.39% to 43,840.91 points.

items.title: Industry needs to ensure that run ups in valuations do not happen again: Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal
items.description: With the recent FII selling seen in the market, Goyal said that India will reach a point where foreign investors will again dominate the Indian markets.
